canonical_explanation.text: To compare numbers, start from the leftmost digit and compare digit by digit. The number with a greater digit at the first differing place is the larger number. Ascending order means smallest to largest; descending order means largest to smallest. Rounding means replacing a number with the nearest 10, 100, or 1000.
rules: To compare, first check the number of digits — more digits means a larger number
If digits are the same count, compare from the leftmost digit
Ascending order: smallest first, largest last
Descending order: largest first, smallest last
For rounding to nearest 10: look at the ones digit — if 5 or more, round up; if less than 5, round down
For rounding to nearest 100: look at the tens digit — if 5 or more, round up; if less than 5, round down

questions.question_text: Which symbol goes in the blank? 4523 ___ 4532
questions.explanation_correct: Comparing 4523 and 4532: thousands are same (4), hundreds are same (5), but tens differ: 2 < 3. So 4523 < 4532.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Compare digit by digit from the left. Thousands (4=4), hundreds (5=5), tens (2<3). Since 2 < 3, 4523 < 4532. Option B.

questions.question_text: Which number is greater: 6789 or 6798?
questions.explanation_correct: Comparing 6789 and 6798: thousands (6=6), hundreds (7=7), tens (8<9). Since 8 < 9, 6798 is greater.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Compare from left: thousands same, hundreds same, tens: 8 < 9. So 6798 > 6789. Option B.

questions.question_text: Which of these is the smallest number?
questions.explanation_correct: 3210 starts with 3, so it is the largest. Among 2310, 2130, 2301: they all start with 2, compare hundreds: 1 < 3, so 2130 is the smallest.
questions.explanation_incorrect: First eliminate 3210 (starts with 3). Among the rest, compare hundreds: 2130 has 1, 2310 has 3, 2301 has 3. 2130 has the smallest hundreds digit, so it is the smallest. Option C.

questions.question_text: Arrange in ascending order: 4500, 4050, 4005, 4550
questions.explanation_correct: Ascending order (smallest to largest): 4005 < 4050 < 4500 < 4550.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Ascending means smallest first. All start with 4. Compare: 4005 (smallest), then 4050, then 4500, then 4550. Option A.

questions.question_text: Arrange in descending order: 1234, 4321, 2143, 3412
questions.explanation_correct: Descending order (largest to smallest): 4321 > 3412 > 2143 > 1234.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Descending means largest first. Compare thousands digits: 4321 (4), 3412 (3), 2143 (2), 1234 (1). So 4321, 3412, 2143, 1234. Option B.

questions.question_text: Using the digits 5, 1, 8, 3 (each once), what is the greatest 4-digit number you can form?
questions.explanation_correct: To form the greatest number, arrange digits in descending order: 8, 5, 3, 1 = 8531.
questions.explanation_incorrect: For the greatest number, place the largest digit first: 8, then 5, then 3, then 1 = 8531. Option A.

questions.question_text: Using the digits 7, 2, 9, 4 (each once), what is the smallest 4-digit number you can form?
questions.explanation_correct: To form the smallest number, arrange digits in ascending order: 2, 4, 7, 9 = 2479.
questions.explanation_incorrect: For the smallest number, place the smallest digit first: 2, then 4, then 7, then 9 = 2479. Option A.

questions.question_text: Round 3847 to the nearest 10.
questions.explanation_correct: The ones digit is 7 (5 or more), so round up. 3847 rounded to the nearest 10 is 3850.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Look at the ones digit: 7. Since 7 >= 5, round up the tens digit from 4 to 5 and make ones 0. So 3847 rounds to 3850. Option B.

questions.question_text: Round 5623 to the nearest 100.
questions.explanation_correct: The tens digit is 2 (less than 5), so round down. 5623 rounded to the nearest 100 is 5600.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Look at the tens digit: 2. Since 2 < 5, round down. The hundreds stay at 6, and tens and ones become 0. So 5600. Option A.

questions.question_text: Round 7500 to the nearest 1000.
questions.explanation_correct: The hundreds digit is 5 (5 or more), so round up. 7500 rounded to the nearest 1000 is 8000.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Look at the hundreds digit: 5. Since 5 >= 5, round up the thousands from 7 to 8. So 7500 rounds to 8000. Option B.

questions.question_text: Meera has Rs 4750 and Sita has Rs 4570. Who has more money?
questions.explanation_correct: Comparing 4750 and 4570: thousands same (4), hundreds: 7 > 5. So 4750 > 4570. Meera has more money.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Compare digit by digit: thousands (4=4), hundreds (7>5). 4750 > 4570, so Meera has more money. Option A.

questions.question_text: Four cities have populations: Delhi Corner: 8920, Lake Town: 8290, Hill View: 9280, River Side: 8092. Arrange in ascending order.
questions.explanation_correct: Ascending: 8092 < 8290 < 8920 < 9280. So River Side, Lake Town, Delhi Corner, Hill View.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sort from smallest to largest: 8092 (River Side), 8290 (Lake Town), 8920 (Delhi Corner), 9280 (Hill View). Option A.

questions.question_text: Rohan has digit cards 6, 0, 3, 9. He wants to make the smallest 4-digit number (no leading zero). What number should he make?
questions.explanation_correct: A 4-digit number cannot start with 0. The smallest non-zero digit is 3. Then arrange remaining (0, 6, 9) in ascending order: 0, 6, 9. The number is 3069.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We cannot start with 0. The next smallest digit is 3. Put 0 right after 3, then 6, then 9: 3069. Option B is the smallest possible.

questions.question_text: A school trip costs Rs 2865 per student. The teacher rounds this to the nearest hundred for estimation. What amount does she use?
questions.explanation_correct: Rounding 2865 to nearest 100: tens digit is 6 (>= 5), so round up. 2865 rounds to 2900.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Look at tens digit: 6. Since 6 >= 5, round up hundreds from 8 to 9. So 2865 rounds to 2900. Option B.

questions.question_text: A 4-digit number is always greater than a 3-digit number. True or false?
questions.explanation_correct: True. The smallest 4-digit number is 1000, and the largest 3-digit number is 999. Since 1000 > 999, every 4-digit number is greater than every 3-digit number.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. The smallest 4-digit number (1000) is already greater than the largest 3-digit number (999).

questions.question_text: Which is the correct descending order? 5000, 5500, 5050, 5505
questions.explanation_correct: Descending order: 5505 > 5500 > 5050 > 5000.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Compare: 5505 is the largest (5 in hundreds), 5500 next, then 5050, then 5000. Option A.

questions.question_text: Round 4445 to the nearest 10.
questions.explanation_correct: Ones digit is 5 (>= 5), so round up. 4445 rounds to 4450.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The ones digit is 5. Since 5 >= 5, round up. 4445 becomes 4450. Option B.

questions.question_text: Using digits 1, 5, 0, 8 (each once), what is the difference between the greatest and smallest 4-digit numbers you can form?
questions.explanation_correct: Greatest: 8510 (digits in descending order). Smallest 4-digit (no leading 0): 1058. Difference: 8510 - 1058 = 7452.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Greatest = 8510 (descending: 8,5,1,0). Smallest = 1058 (can't start with 0, so start with 1, then 0,5,8). 8510 - 1058 = 7452. Option C.

questions.question_text: How many 4-digit numbers are greater than 7000 but less than 7010?
questions.explanation_correct: Numbers greater than 7000 but less than 7010: 7001, 7002, 7003, 7004, 7005, 7006, 7007, 7008, 7009. That is 9 numbers.

questions.question_text: Using digits 2, 2, 5, 5 (with repetition as given), how many different 4-digit numbers can you form? Which is the greatest?
questions.explanation_correct: To form the greatest number with digits 2, 2, 5, 5, arrange in descending order: 5, 5, 2, 2 = 5522.
questions.explanation_incorrect: For the greatest number, put the largest digits first: 5, 5, 2, 2 = 5522. Option A.

questions.question_text: When 6350 is rounded to the nearest 1000, the result is:
questions.explanation_correct: To round to nearest 1000, look at hundreds digit: 3. Since 3 < 5, round down. 6350 rounds to 6000.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Hundreds digit is 3 (< 5), so round down. 6350 rounds to 6000. Option A.

questions.question_text: Which is greater: 999 or 1001?
questions.explanation_correct: 1001 has 4 digits while 999 has 3 digits. A number with more digits is always greater (among positive numbers). So 1001 > 999.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 1001 has 4 digits, 999 has 3. More digits means greater number. 1001 > 999. Option B.

questions.question_text: The weights (in grams) of 4 fruits are: Mango 345, Apple 289, Banana 118, Orange 310. Arrange in descending order of weight.
questions.explanation_correct: Descending: 345 > 310 > 289 > 118. So Mango, Orange, Apple, Banana.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Largest to smallest: 345 (Mango), 310 (Orange), 289 (Apple), 118 (Banana). Option A.

questions.question_text: Round 1234 to the nearest 10.
questions.explanation_correct: Ones digit is 4 (< 5), so round down. 1234 rounds to 1230.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Ones digit 4 < 5, so round down. 1234 becomes 1230. Option A.

questions.question_text: A shop sold 3478 items in January and 3487 items in February. In which month did the shop sell more items?
questions.explanation_correct: 3478 vs 3487: thousands same (3), hundreds same (4), tens: 7 < 8. So 3487 > 3478. February had more sales.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Compare: 3478 vs 3487. First three digits from left: 3, 4, 7 = 3, 4, 8. Tens differ: 7 < 8. So 3487 (February) > 3478 (January). Option B.

questions.question_text: Using digits 0, 3, 7, 5 (each once), the difference between the greatest and smallest 4-digit numbers is:
questions.explanation_correct: Greatest: 7530 (descending: 7,5,3,0). Smallest (no leading 0): 3057 (start with 3, then 0,5,7). Difference = 7530 - 3057 = 4473.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Greatest = 7530 (digits in descending order). Smallest = 3057 (can't start with 0, so start with 3, then 0,5,7). 7530 - 3057 = 4473. Option B.

questions.question_text: A number when rounded to the nearest 100 gives 4500. Which of these could be the original number?
questions.explanation_correct: Numbers that round to 4500 are from 4450 to 4549. 4462 is in this range, so it rounds to 4500.
questions.explanation_incorrect: For a number to round to 4500, it must be between 4450 and 4549. Check: 4440 (rounds to 4400), 4462 (rounds to 4500), 4551 (rounds to 4600), 4449 (rounds to 4400). Option B.

questions.question_text: What comes just before 5000 (predecessor)?
questions.explanation_correct: The predecessor of 5000 is 5000 - 1 = 4999.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Predecessor means the number just before. 5000 - 1 = 4999. Option A.

questions.question_text: What comes just after 9999 (successor)?
questions.explanation_correct: The successor of 9999 is 9999 + 1 = 10000.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Successor means the number just after. 9999 + 1 = 10000. Option B.

questions.question_text: Which is the greatest 3-digit number?
questions.explanation_correct: The greatest 3-digit number is 999. 1000 is a 4-digit number.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The greatest 3-digit number has 9 in all three places: 999. 1000 has 4 digits so it doesn't count. Option C.

questions.question_text: Round 8765 to the nearest 1000.
questions.explanation_correct: Hundreds digit is 7 (>= 5), so round up. 8765 rounds to 9000.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Look at hundreds digit: 7. Since 7 >= 5, round up thousands from 8 to 9. So 8765 rounds to 9000. Option B.

questions.question_text: Using the digits 4, 0, 0, 7 (each used as given), what is the greatest 4-digit number?
questions.explanation_correct: Arrange in descending order: 7, 4, 0, 0 = 7400.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Place largest digit first: 7, then 4, then 0, 0 = 7400. Option A.

questions.question_text: Rahul says 3599 > 3601. Is he correct?
questions.explanation_correct: Comparing: thousands same (3), hundreds: 5 < 6. So 3599 < 3601. Rahul is incorrect.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Compare from left: thousands (3=3), hundreds (5<6). Since 5 < 6, 3599 < 3601. Rahul is wrong. Option B.

questions.question_text: Which of these numbers stays the same when rounded to the nearest 10?
questions.explanation_correct: 4560 already ends in 0, so rounding to the nearest 10 does not change it. It stays 4560.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A number ending in 0 is already a multiple of 10. 4560 rounds to 4560 (no change). Option C.

questions.question_text: Arrange these distances in ascending order: Delhi to Agra: 233 km, Delhi to Jaipur: 281 km, Delhi to Lucknow: 556 km, Delhi to Chandigarh: 243 km
questions.explanation_correct: Ascending: 233 < 243 < 281 < 556. So Agra, Chandigarh, Jaipur, Lucknow.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sort smallest to largest: 233, 243, 281, 556. Option A.

questions.question_text: Using digits 1, 2, 3 (each once), what is the greatest 3-digit number?
questions.explanation_correct: Arrange in descending order: 3, 2, 1 = 321.
questions.explanation_incorrect: For greatest number, place largest digit first: 3, 2, 1 = 321. Option B.

questions.question_text: Round 450 to the nearest 100.
questions.explanation_correct: Tens digit is 5 (>= 5), so round up. 450 rounds to 500.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Tens digit is 5. Since 5 >= 5, round up. 450 becomes 500. Option B.

questions.question_text: How many numbers are there between 4500 and 4510 (not including 4500 and 4510)?
questions.explanation_correct: Numbers between 4500 and 4510 (not including either): 4501, 4502, 4503, 4504, 4505, 4506, 4507, 4508, 4509. That is 9 numbers.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Count: 4501, 4502, ..., 4509. That is 4509 - 4501 + 1 = 9 numbers. Option B.

questions.question_text: Five friends scored in a game: Anil 4520, Bina 4502, Charu 4052, Deepak 4250, Esha 4205. Who came third when arranged in descending order?
questions.explanation_correct: Descending: 4520 (Anil), 4502 (Bina), 4250 (Deepak), 4205 (Esha), 4052 (Charu). Third is Deepak.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rank from highest: Anil (4520), Bina (4502), Deepak (4250), Esha (4205), Charu (4052). Third place: Deepak. Option B.

questions.question_text: Round 3555 to the nearest 100.
questions.explanation_correct: Tens digit is 5 (>= 5), so round up. 3555 rounds to 3600.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Look at tens digit: 5. Since 5 >= 5, round up hundreds from 5 to 6. So 3555 rounds to 3600. Option B.

questions.question_text: What is the smallest 4-digit number with all different digits?
questions.explanation_correct: We need all different digits. 1000 has repeated 0s. The smallest is 1023 (digits 1, 0, 2, 3 - all different).
questions.explanation_incorrect: 1000 repeats 0. We need all different digits. Start with 1 (smallest non-zero), then 0, then 2, then 3 = 1023. Option A.

questions.question_text: Fill in the correct symbol: 2750 ___ 2750
questions.explanation_correct: Both numbers are the same: 2750 = 2750.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The two numbers are identical, so they are equal. The correct symbol is =, option C.

questions.question_text: Round 9950 to the nearest 100.
questions.explanation_correct: Tens digit is 5 (>= 5), so round up. 9950 rounds to 10000.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Tens digit 5 >= 5, so round up hundreds 9 to 10. But hundreds become 10, so it carries over: 9950 rounds to 10000. Option B.

questions.question_text: Arrange in ascending order: 100, 1000, 10, 10000
questions.explanation_incorrect: Smallest to largest: 10, 100, 1000, 10000. Option A.

questions.question_text: The greatest 4-digit number using digits 3, 0, 5, 0 (using all) is:
questions.explanation_correct: Arrange in descending order: 5, 3, 0, 0 = 5300.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Descending order of digits 5, 3, 0, 0 gives 5300. Option A.

questions.question_text: 5099 is greater than 5100. True or false?
questions.explanation_correct: False. Thousands are same (5). Hundreds: 0 < 1. So 5099 < 5100.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Compare: thousands (5=5), hundreds (0<1). So 5099 < 5100. The statement is false. Option B.

questions.question_text: A factory produces 6748 toys. For a report, this is rounded to the nearest 1000. What number is reported?
questions.explanation_correct: Hundreds digit is 7 (>= 5), so round up. 6748 rounds to 7000.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Hundreds digit 7 >= 5, round up. 6748 becomes 7000. Option B.

questions.question_text: What is the successor of 9999?
questions.explanation_incorrect: The successor (next number) of 9999 is 10000. Option A.

questions.question_text: Using digits 6, 2, 8, 4 (each once), the smallest 4-digit number is:
questions.explanation_correct: Arrange in ascending order: 2, 4, 6, 8 = 2468.
questions.explanation_incorrect: For the smallest number, place digits in ascending order: 2, 4, 6, 8 = 2468. Option A.

questions.question_text: When a number is rounded to the nearest 10, the result is 4580. Which of these could be the original number?
questions.explanation_correct: Numbers that round to 4580 (nearest 10) range from 4575 to 4584. 4584 is in this range.
questions.explanation_incorrect: For rounding to 4580, the number must be between 4575 and 4584. Check: 4573 rounds to 4570, 4584 rounds to 4580, 4586 rounds to 4590, 4589 rounds to 4590. Option B.
